Title: engineer/architect/autocad
Description:
engineer/architect/autocad

compensation: above industry average
employment type: full-time
two positions available as we expand: ENGINEER and/or ARCHITECT(auto cad) wanted as we grow our engineering and architectural services firm.

We are a 14 employee Professional Corp., located in LONG ISLAND CITY, Queens, we provide owner and contractor support for a wide range of DOB requirements, from full architectural renovations to permanent structural designs, and many contractor required engineering products. 

We are in need of both of the following:

STAFF STRUCTURAL ENGINEER: experienced/proficient with autocad, 1-2 years minimum experience. Passion for buildable cost effective, code compliant solutions is required, with the ability to communicate and defend designs in formal calculations and theory for building and temporary component analysis. 
Duties are predominantly autocad production, but will also be asked to attend field inspections, job site meetings and DOB plan exams. 

STAFF ARCHITECT: experienced/proficient with autocad, 1-2 years minimum experience. Passion for efficient designs, strong interest in many components of building codes, regulations and procedures. Duties are predominantly autocad production, but may be asked to attend job site meetings and DOB plan exams. Chief products are renovation applications, and a large quantity of Site Safety Plans, Egress Analysis, ATRU plans for contractors. 

WE ARE ALSO CONSIDERING APPLICANTS WITH MORE EXPERIENCE, AND WILL COMPENSATE ACCORDINGLY. we are also open to entry level, provided autocad experience. We are equal opportunity employer.

BENEFITS:
As well as above industry standard salaries, we offer employer contribution in health/dental care, 401k matching saving plan, weekly employer sponsored team building lunch, in-house continuing ed (as part of our DOB/IAS accreditation), and basically an all around good rewarding time producing highly respected products!

For consideration:
IN COVER LETTER, PLEASE STATE ANYTHING YOU WOULD LIKE US TO KNOW ABOUT WHY YOU ARE A GOOD CHOICE, PLEASE INCLUDE YOUR SALARY RANGE REQUIREMENTS. 
Please include resume in body of email or as pdf, not word doc or google drive.

IMPORTANT: please list either: structural engg applicant, or architect applicant, in the subject of the email.

Title: High skill fabricator/Installer/Scenic
Description:
We are a fabrication shop for a high end luxury retail store.  We do not work for multiple clients as we are financed by the store we build for.  Our work consists of highly visible displays(both windows and in store), events (2 day activations to 2 month pop up shops), fabrication and installation of digital marketing installations (tv plinths, event walls, projections).

We currently need a carpenter, who can read plans and build accordingly, also experienced enough to improvise without changing the design aesthetic.  Hours can be crazy,  we can work up to 14hr days when were meeting a deadline, but then have to weather the storm through the slow times as well (30hr weeks).  Most of our work is done 9-6 at our shop, but installing usually takes place after store hours 8pm and later.  

Skills/Experience:
Finish carpentry, production carpentry, set building, plan reading, project management, laminating, making cut lists, material management, computer knowledge, CAD knowledge.  Proficiency in all basic fabrication shop tools including but not limited to: spray booth, fork lift operation, welding, table saw, band saw, routers, panel saw, and intuition are all useful.

Title: SENIOR ARCHITECT
Description:
Cowley Engineering, PC provides Structural and Forensic Engineering services for defect analysis, repurposing and repair of buildings and parking structures.  We take pride in empowering our clients by providing information, options and solutions that best fit their needs. 

We are searching for the following professional:  Senior Architect - Salary $100k-$120k.  Location:  Office in Stamford, CT with projects in Westchester County, Fairfield County, Bergen County and New York City. 

The ideal candidate for this position will possess an RA license and have familiarity with waterproofing and the rehabilitation and preservation of historic structures.  

Characteristics this candidate must possess are: leadership, a curious nature, writing and public speaking skills, the ability to work independently, outgoing personality and ambition.

 Responsibilities include:

•Assessment of multi-story commercial and residential buildings including planning for and supervision of execution of repairs of such buildings. 

•Provide direction for the creation of design plans and specifications for repairs including CAD drafting for the preparation of design drawings and specifications.

•Conduct site inspections and investigative analysis toward completion of assigned design tasks.

•Review staff quantity calculations including bills of materials and summaries of quantities.  

•Prepare structural element analysis and details for drafting.

•Perform field inspections without a fear of heights.

•Check calculations and drawings.

•Perform independent code research.

•Organize and schedule specific tasks and assignments for staff.

•Supervise and prepare repair related cost estimates, plans and reports.

•Work with expeditors to prepare permit applications for projects.

•Maintain project documentation, calculations, filings, etc.

•Must have working knowledge of Vectorworks (preferred) or Auto-CAD, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Word. (Macintosh Versions)

•Must have excellent communication and organization skills.

•Travel to/in the NYC metro area and field work will be necessary.

•Any other tasks that may be assigned.

Candidates who fit the description should email their resume to:

Bree DePalo, Office Manager
Bree@CowleyEngineering.com


Cowley Engineering, PC
1100 Summer Street
Stamford, CT 06905

Please, no phone calls

Title: Civil Engineer Estimator Site Work/Heavy Construction
Description:
Civil Estimator for site work needed with minimum 5 to 10 years of experience in Sitework/Roadwork estimating (earthwork, paving, utilities, concrete, bridges, demolition, piles,underpinning)

Work for an well-established professional Contractor serving the TriState area.
Must have experience in and a strong command of Quantity take-offs, soliciting bids from subcontractors and suppliers, 
Preferred software Proficiency: Trimble HCE, HCSS, Agtek, OnScreen and AutoCad
Provide overall estimating for civil aspects of medium to large construction projects.

 Duties and Responsibilities: 
*Take off and price: excavation (large mass earth/rock excavation & cut to fill operations), site utilities, demolition, piles, paving, earth retention, hardscape, landscaping and other site development related work. 
*Prepare scopes of work, solicit bids and evaluate pricing for all subcontractors
*Coordinate scopes with estimators scoping other trades to insure no missing scope or overlap. 
*Evaluate Project Documents for constructability and value engineering issues 
*Review project geotechnical reports. Make recommendations regarding material suitability for fill or backfill, rock quality and quantities
*Evaluate and make recommendations for alternative building foundation solutions. 
*Participate in design development meetings and decisions on Design Build and Design Assist projects to ensure design of civil work provides best value to the project. 
*Develop and maintain subcontractor relations to ensure the client is viewed as a favored contractor by subcontractors. 
*Work on multiple projects and with multiple supervisors at once. 
*Prepare and present complete bid proposals to principals and to clients.  
Actively involve yourself with engineers and architects to develop value engineering benefits

Excellent opportunity for long term employment.  Your future and success will be a direct result of your own efforts and skills.

Title: Revit Drafter needed at High-End Glass Wall Company
Description:
Hi! Thanks for your interest, please check out the details below, and if it seems like the right position for you, please reach out with any questions:

JOB DESCRIPTION 
Wing Partners is looking for an architectural Revit drafter to join our company. Currently we do all of our shop drawings in 2D with AutoCAD, and we need someone to help us translate those to Revit. You'll be working alongside experienced project managers who manage multi-million dollar projects, building workplaces for fortune 500 companies. We specialize in glass wall systems for office interiors. (Check out our website for photos www.wingpartners.com). Please note that this is not a design role, but your Revit experience should specifically be in architecture or interior design. 

You will be consulting with our project managers on the details of each project's design, to convert AutoCAD drawings to Revit. You'll also be consulting with the factory to ensure that our Revit process is correct and that the results can be inserted into their production system.

RESPONSIBILITIES 
* Review construction documents
* Develop shop drawings in Revit based on 2D AutoCAD drawings, including plans, elevations, sections, and details
* Assist project managers with change orders, as-built drawings, and other related project tasks
* There may be an opportunity to assist with a broader scope of project management if that appeals to you
   
REQUIREMENTS
* Proficiency in both Revit and AutoCAD
* Be able to read and understand construction documents
* Strong communication skills in English
* Self-driven, detail oriented, well organized.  
* Located in the NYC metro area

Title: Senior Hardware/Software Electrical Engineer
Description:
WHO WE ARE: MIDI is an established Award Winning Product Development firm located in Smithtown, NY specializing in innovative product engineering and design solutions for the medical and scientific markets. With over 45 years of product development consulting experience, having served clientele representing diverse industries both in the US and internationally, our success is based on our multi-disciplined, talented team. And, we are seeking additional team members!

WHO WE SEEK: Here is a basic description of how our instruments are typically structured and the type of skill-set we would be looking for in a Senior Electrical Engineer:

Starting from a high-level, the systems are typically controlled by Windows on an off-the-shelf SBC.  Within the Windows environment we need to develop a program and GUI to control the instrument using C#.NET.  The SBC will then instruct our "Main Embedded PCB" on tasks it needs to perform.  This Main-PCB will control/sense a combination of both analogue and digital components like PID-Heating, stepper motors, pumps, RTD, TC, optical & hall interrupts, etc.  We will need to generate schematics/layout/BOM on this PCB along with the C-code firmware to control the components.  Successful Engineers at MIDI are involved in the conceptualization and development of new and innovative products and work directly on-site as a team member and with our client's staff. Your role will be to design and prototype designs using EDA software and testing and improving upon designs.

WHO YOU ARE: You should possess a BS or MS and ideally 5+ years of Experience.   Additionally, you are enthusiastic, creative and a hands-on person.  As a strategic, critical and analytical thinker, you are creative at problem solving, intellectually curious, independent, self-starting and proactive. You are comfortable having daily contact with the company owners and can manage programs involving engineering/product development with ease.
If you are interested, please reply to this posting with only a PDF resume. No jpegs or photos please. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Architect or Engineer w/ CA Experience
Description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking an or engineer with 5 to 10 years of exterior restoration experience, including experience in construction administration.  

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls. We take pride in being an industry leader in such practice areas as Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. 

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.  

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.  

Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).  

SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.  

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.  

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday. 

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away. 

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).  

Note: Our thanks in advance to those submitting applications; only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Lead HVAC Mechanic Needed
Description:
The Osborn in Rye, NY Is looking for a Full-Time HVAC Mechanic.


Under the direction of the Director of Facilities and Property and the Facility Supervisor, the HVAC Mechanic inspects, operates, maintains, installs, and upgrades various types of heating, ventilation, and air conditioning and refrigeration equipment.  Also manages the A/C shop, submits inventory lists, orders refrigerant, prioritizes work requests, and provides direction when working with Facilities staff.        

High School diploma or GED
Fluent in English both written and verbal
Strong knowledge of local and national hvac and refrigeration codes
Must hold a Universal EPA Refrigerant Handlers Certificate
Must be able to work with black iron, cast iron, malleable steel, copper, brass, and plastic pipe.
Must be able to cut, thread, hang, braze, sweat, and install the above-mentioned material.
Must be knowledgeable in DDC controls, process controls valves, and related systems.
Must be able to plan and implement new equipment installations and special projects.
Must be able to exercise supervision. 
Good communication is a must and must be competent to deal with Osborn Residents.
